text: Brown crystals of the rare vanadium mineral saneroite from the type locality in Valgraveglia mine (Reppia, Ne, Graveglia Valley, Genova Province, Liguria, Italy) Saneroite (Na2(Mn,Mn)10Si11VO34(OH)4) is a silicate mineral found in Italy. It is named after Edoardo Sanero, a professor at the University of Genova.Mindat.org - SaneroiteWebmineral.com - SaneroiteHandbook of Mineralogy - Saneroite ==References== Category:Inosilicates Category:Triclinic minerals
title: Saneroite
